title: How to Save a Link in Google Chrome

steps.title: Search the web for the site you want to save.
steps.content: Search the web for the site you want to save. Don't follow the link once you find itâ€”just make sure it's visible in your browser. [1] X Research source

steps.title: This option lets you choose where to save the file.
steps.content: This option lets you choose where to save the file. You'll also be able to enter a custom file name if you'd like.

steps.title: Locate and double-click the folder you want to save the file to.
steps.content: Locate and double-click the folder you want to save the file to. The folder you select is where you'll be able to find the saved page later. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Save button to save the file to your computer.
steps.content: Click the Save button to save the file to your computer. The link will save as an HTML file, which is a page full of code. When you want to open the saved link, just double-click the file to open it in your web browser. [3] X Research source
